snippet: An emergency order from the Federal Railroad Administration said the commuter railroad must provide two employees to operate trains where major speed limits are in place.
abstract: Federal Railroad Administration issues emergency order requiring Metropolitan Transportation Agency to put two people in place to operate Metro-North trains at potentially dangerous sites; directive, following fatal December derailment in Bronx, will remain in place until railroad updates its signal system to better enforce speed limits.
lead_paragraph: An emergency order from the Federal Railroad Administration said the commuter railroad must provide two employees to operate trains where major speed limits are in place.

headline.main: U.S. Orders Changes at Metro-North After Derailment
headline.print_headline: Federal Agency Orders Changes At Metro-North After Derailment
